cab.content: [This document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty^ Government.] Printed for the Cabinet. November 1932.SECRET.CP. 110 (32). Copy No. CABINET.Reports by Local Governments on the Political Situation in India. I circulate for the information of my colleagues the latest weekly reports from theLocal Governments in India. S. H. INDIA OFFICE, 29th November 1932.Government of India. There is no change in the situation. The Ordinance Bill is making slow progressin the Assembly, hut the Government have obtained a substantial majority in alldecisions.Delhi. Congress remains inactive. Section 3 : arrests, nil ; total detained, 3.Section 4: fresh orders, nil; total to date in respect of whom orders are inforce, 43. Convictions to date for contravening orders number 10.Bombay. Congress activities are negligible, and no new development has taken place. Ten-picketers were arrested during the week in Bombay city. Three raids by the policeled to some arrests and to the seizure of uniforms and unauthorised literature. Aspecial session of the Legislative Council to consider the Bombay Special Powers bill was opened on 22nd November by His Excellency the Governor. Ordinance 10.Section 3 : arrests, 32; total under detention, 92. Section 4; orders, 31 ; total inforce, 1,034. Section 17 : convictions, 10.Bengal. Civil disobedience activity has been unimportant. Midnapore and Arambagh arequiet. It is reported that troops flat marching in Vishnupur sub-division received agood reception. Arrests, 11; convictions, 35. Section 4 : orders (excluding Calcuttaand Kajshahi) issued, 19 ; in force, 149.Madras. The situation remains quiet and unchanged.Central Provinces. The week has been entirely quiet. Prosecutions, nil; convictions, 2.United Provinces. The rise in the weekly number of convictions, which began last week, hascontinued and is due to Congress leaders' concentration on a policy of boycott incertain districts. Section 3, Special Powers Ordinance, was not used. Twelve orders under section 4 issued, and one conviction for defiance of order under that section.Convictions during week under Ordinance, 34 ; under ordinary law, 67. Total, 101.Grand total, 12,528. Total of releases and apologies, 3,066.Punjab. There has been a feeble recrudescence of Congress activity, mainly in Lyallpur.Thirteen arrests, all under Ordinance. The Province generally is undisturbed. One-section 3 prisoner released ; total under arrest, 3. Other figures remain unchanged. 1472 60 11.32 oNorth-West Frontier Province. Section 3 : arrests., nil ; total detained, 1. Section -1 : orders, 4 ; total orders in-force, 51. The situation throughout the Province is normal.Bihar and Orissa. There is nothing to report. Five orders are still in force under section 4..Number of convictions up to 19th November, 11,108.Assam. There is nothing of interest to report.Ajmer Merwara. One arrest has been made during the week. There is nothing of importance to-report.From the Resident, Mysore. The weekly report from Coorg and Bangalore is the same as last week.
